channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Documents Show E.P.A. Wants to Erase Greenhouse Gas Limits on Power Plants
item.description: The agency plans to argue that carbon emissions from power plants do not contribute “significantly” to climate change. Scientists disagree.

item.title: The Beaches Are Open in New York City. So Are the Lifeguard Chairs.
item.description: Beach season began Saturday with 280 lifeguards, well short of what the city needs, amid a yearslong staffing shortage. But more will come by summer’s...

item.title: Susan Brownmiller, Who Reshaped Views About Rape, Dies at 90
item.description: Her book “Against Our Will” argued that rape was a crime of power and violence, not passion; it led to laws that made it easier to prosecute rapists.

item.title: Why Vietnam Ignored Its Own Laws to Fast-Track a Trump Family Golf Complex
item.description: As President Trump blurs the lines between politics and business — and threatens steep tariffs on trade partners — governments feel compelled to favor...

item.title: Inside a Trump Family Project in Vietnam
item.description: As President Trump blurs the lines between politics and business — and threatens steep tariffs on trade partners — governments feel compelled to favor...

item.title: U.S. Man Who Lived Abroad With Family’s Nanny Is Charged in Wife’s Murder
item.description: A man who appeared to be a grieving husband after he found his wife fatally shot at their Georgia business in 2006 was arrested this week and charged ...

item.title: Junkiest junk is offering a warning sign for debt
item.description: The lowest rung of junk bonds are flashing warnings that the economy could face slower growth and higher inflation, as well as the risk of a recession...

item.title: King Dollar won’t just give up its crown. Rivals have to take it away—but they’re not ready, currency expert says
item.description: "Unless that changes, the dollar will remain on a much longer leash than any currency should rightfully have."

item.title: Musk vows to be ‘super focused’ on companies amid X outages
item.description: “Back to spending 24/7 at work and sleeping in conference/server/factory rooms,” Musk wrote in a post on X on Saturday.

item.title: There’s a ‘buyer’s strike’ on U.S. assets as foreign investors can’t stomach huge deficits anymore, analyst warns
item.description: "At the core of the problem is that foreign investors are simply no longer willing to finance US twin deficits at current level of prices."

item.title: Trump Gives Commencement Address at West Point, Stressing a New Era
item.description: The president said the graduating cadets would enter a service no longer subject to “absurd ideological experiments” or “nation-building crusades.”

item.title: Trump tells West Point graduates ‘we do not need an officer corps of careerists and yes men’
item.description: “We need patriots with guts and vision and backbone.”

item.title: Power Outage in Cannes During Film Festival Is Sabotage, Officials Say
item.description: An arson attack and damage to a transmission tower cut off power in the area, the authorities said. The festival’s closing ceremony on Saturday is sch...

item.title: The Israeli Connections to a New Gaza Aid Plan Promoted as Independent
item.description: Foreign contractors are set to carry out a contentious new food aid system in Gaza, displacing experienced aid agencies like the United Nations. It wa...

item.title: Russia and Ukraine Exchange Air Assaults Amid Major Prisoner Swap
item.description: The hourslong raids, involving hundreds of drones, were a reminder that any diplomatic resolution to the conflict remains far off.
